Android AMF library


AMF library provides a seamless and easy way for android applications to make remote procedure calls using an optimal binary protocol from Adobe - AMF 3.0 and guarantees a faster response time from the server.

The library supports remoting and secured remoting for Android applications.
The library helps to reduce the response time of a android application communicating with a server backend. Once the call is made, the android application has a choice to perform other independent tasks - and hence make mobile application more responsive. The response is received from the server in the form of a call back of success or failure. The marshalling and de-marshalling of objects is automatically taken care by the client library. The application should statically link the library.


Packages
com.al.amf.client Android amf client-related classes.
com.al.amf.events The package contains the RPC event classes.
com.al.amf.remoting Remoting service classes.
com.al.lib Library initialization and validation classes.
